intro: Arbutus prostrata, commonly known as the low bush strawberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its low, spreading growth habit and dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red, edible berries in the fall. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in coastal areas and shaded woodlands. Arbutus prostrata plays an important ecological role by providing food for various wildlife species.
